css._notice_: This section is for manually disabling/enabling features.
css._removeAppleLogo_comment: Removes Apple Logo when enabled. (true by default)
css._removeUpsell_comment: Removes the open iTunes button if enabled (true by default)

macOS._emulateMacOS_comment: This enables various adjustments that make the Apple Music interface look like the MacOS Apple Music UI (Stoplights / Window Controls / No Upsell / No Logo)
macOS._windowControls_comment: This enables the MacOS Window Controls (Stop Lights). Enable Windows Style if you want the stop lights but to replicate the Windows controls (Right placed)
macOS._scrollbar_comment: This enables the Sleek macos-style scrollbar.

preferences._notice_: This is the basic user preferences. Modify to your liking below.
preferences._defaultTheme_comment: Default UI theme (Light/Dark) or leave empty to detect from system.
preferences._cssTheme_comment: If you are using a custom CSS theme, set it below, otherwise leave empty.
preferences._closeButtonMinimize_comment: Should the close button minimize your apple music (true) or should it quit the app (false). (true by default)
preferences._discordRPC_comment: Enable/Disable Discord Rich Presence. (true by default)
preferences._playbackNotifications_comment: Enabling this means you will get notifications when you change song. The notificationsMinimized option force notifications to only appear if the app is hidden / minimized.
preferences._trayTooltipSongName_comment: Enabling this option allows you to see the song name in the tooltip on the taskbar when the application is minimized to the tray.
preferences._mprisSupport_comment: Do you want to turn on Mpris support, connects to the Mpris interface for Linux. (Make sure you have it installed if you turn this on)

advanced._disableCORS_comment: This is also known as WebSecurity and Should be Toggled if you are experiencing issues.
